Class MultiRenderer

java.lang.Object
us.mn.state.dot.tms.utils.MultiAdapter
us.mn.state.dot.tms.utils.MultiRenderer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Multi
public class MultiRenderer extends MultiAdapter
A MULTI renderer is for rendering MULTI on a raster graphic.
Author:
Douglas Lau, John L. Stanley - SRF Consulting

  • Constructor Details

    • MultiRenderer

      public MultiRenderer(RasterGraphic.Factory fct, int cw, int ch, int f, ColorScheme cs)
      Create a new MULTI renderer.
      Parameters:
      fct - Raster graphic factory.
      cw - Character width (pixels) for character-matrix signs. Use 0 for line-matrix or full-matrix signs.
      ch - Character height (pixels) for character- or line-matrix signs. Use 0 for full-matrix signs.
      f - Default font number.
      cs - Color scheme.

      Specified by:
      setColorBackground in interface Multi
      Overrides:

      Parameters:

    • setPageBackground

      public void setPageBackground(Integer z)
      Set the page background color using a single-int color tag. [pbZ]
      Specified by:
      setPageBackground in interface Multi
      Overrides:
      setPageBackground in class MultiAdapter
      Parameters:
      z - Background color (0-1 for monochrome1bit), (0-255 for monochrome8bit), (0-9 for colorClassic & color24bit). Use sign's default background color if z is null.

      Parameters:

      Specified by:

      Overrides:
      setColorForeground in class MultiAdapter
      Parameters:
      x - Foreground color (0-1 for monochrome1bit), (0-255 for monochrome8bit), (0-9 for colorClassic & color24bit). If x is null, use the sign's default foreground color.

    • addColorRectangle

      public void addColorRectangle(int x, int y, int w, int h, int z)
      Add a color rectangle using a single-int color tag. [crX,Y,W,H,Z]
      Specified by:
      addColorRectangle in interface Multi
      Overrides:
      addColorRectangle in class MultiAdapter
      Parameters:
      x - X pixel position of upper left corner.
      y - Y pixel position of upper left corner.
      w - Width in pixels.
      h - Height in pixels.
      z - Color of rectangle (0-1 for monochrome1bit), (0-255 for monochrome8bit), (0-9 for colorClassic & color24bit).
